intro: Stranvaesia, commonly known as the red hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, with some species found in the Americas. The plants are characterized by their showy, often brightly colored flowers, which can be single or double, and their alternate, heart-shaped leaves. Stranvaesia species typically grow as shrubs or small trees, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. They thrive in well-drained soil and full sun, making them popular ornamental plants in warm climates.
